title: Bus Tracker Application
description: Created a Bus-Tracker application to improve customer public bus search experience. Used Ajax to dynamically update a web page that contained a map with “push-pins” and a table to display to track bus movement, as well as allow users to search for buses that traveled over particular speeds. Code was developed using MERN stack.
details: Created an interactive map using JavaScript’s MapQuest library.
Collected route info: latitude, longitude, speed, distance, etc. using Node.js, Express, and MongoDB for server-side development.
Executed data requests to the server and loaded that JSON encoded data to webpage using Ajax and GET.
Enhanced User Experience for easy interface, functionality, and speed through Bootstrap, CSS3, and React.

title: Data Chart
description: Created a web page that presented data results in a table format as well as a graphical chart format.
details: Used Bootstrap to create a responsive HTML page.
Used jQuery and selectors to access and modify the DOM.
Defined and implemented jQuery-based event handlers, callbacks and animations.
Used the HTML <canvas> and Chart.js external library to create the graphical chart.

title: 1st personal Webpage (NOT THIS ONE)!
description: Developed personal website that would allow recruiters, students, and friends to see what I have been doing career wise and life wise
details: Queried tabs to different pages of website through jQuery so that no server side code was needed.
Shorten code writing through arrow functions
